ngiemboon: À nǎ mezẅìŋ nzsǒ né pʉ̀a.
en: He gave the old clothes to the madman.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ ně ńtóŋo nyìŋ mɛ́, à tè zẅíŋ.
en: They called that person, she didn't answer.
those there (middle distant demonstrative pronoun that refers to class 4 or 6 nouns)
those there (middle demonstrative adjective modifying class 4 and 6 nouns)

ngiemboon: Pi ge gʉa na mepɔ̀ɔn mɔɔn é kaa mɛ̌?
en: Which of the following bags will you wear?

ngiemboon: Mêmvfó gaʼté lê mɛ̌ɛʼ, ńdɔg ńtóŋo múɔ.
en: To call the kid, the goat quavered.
those there (distant demonstrative pronoun referring to class 4 and 6 nouns)
those ... there (distant demonstrative adjective modifying class 4 and 6 nouns)

ngiemboon: Metÿǒ mɔɔn, é té sag, emi ésag mboŋó.
en: These trees are not long, these are very long.
yours (second person plural possessive pronoun referring back to class 4 and 6 nouns)
your (second person plural possessive adjective modifying class 4 and 6 nouns)
your (second person plural emphatic possessive adjective modifying class 4 and 6 nouns)

ngiemboon: À gɔ̌ɔn ngie n too ńjú mencʉ́ŋ, ńjú mí.
en: He said when I buy the bottles, I buy yours.
who (relative pronoun modifying class 4 and 6 nouns)

ngiemboon: Mekwɔ̀ʼɔ mie é kɔʼɔ́ jʉʼɔɔn pfǒ nzɔ̌?
en: Where are the stools that were here?

ngiemboon: À gẅiin nkáb tà é tɔ́gɔ tàʼ mileyôŋ.
en: He has money over a million.
